features: Contains (1) resealable pouch with 45 individual packs of dishwasher soap inside
Dishwasher detergent packs with mineral and plant-based stain lifting power.
Free of phosphates and chlorine bleach.
Works hard in hard water. Powerful rinse-aid action.

This refreshing Lemon Mint scent evokes the vibrant zest of lemons with a hint of herbaceous mint.
Proudly doing business with a purpose.
body.description: Grimy glasses and dirty dishes are no match for the plant and mineral-based stain lifting power in our dishwasher packs. Free of phosphates and chlorine bleach, these powerful little pillows cut through grease and laugh in the face of stuck-on leftovers, leaving dishes sparkling and squeaky clean.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Method Dish Soap Method Gel Hand Wash Method Daily Granite Cleaner Method All Purpose Cleaner

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Try it you will like it
reviews.reviewText: I have used the National brands for my dishwasher. The dishes did not come clean. One cycle and everything was so much cleaner than before. Love the scent too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Clean and Clear here!
reviews.reviewText: I bought these knowing the concern about the residue being left behind. I live in Florida and the water here is pretty hard, so I figured there’s a high risk it’ll happen, so I only bought one bag.My suggestion to anyone who is struggling with the residue or is worried about the residue is to get rinse aid. I’m not 100% sure if that’s the solution, but I used the Seventh Generation Rinse Aid and my dishes came out clear. (I did a very small load to test before potentially ruining a whole wash by the way)Why go through the trouble, especially if you've never had to rinse aid before? My personal reason is that this is one of the few brands I know and love, because 1. It doesn’t do any animal testing on any of their products 2. It’s a more environmentally friendly company than the regular big corporation store brand. The first ingredients are far softer too, not jam packed with heavy duty chemicals, but just enough needed to get everything clean. I order everything cleaning from them, and try out different scents all the time. They’re not overpowering but also not so diluted that you wonder why you bother getting scented in the first place.I can usually buy all their stuff in bulk (sets of 6 or 4) which saves on the amount of times I need to order in any given time frame.I love Method so I decided to try this out knowing the risk, and I’m very relieved that this is another product of theirs that I can support and use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Must Use Detergent Booster & Rinse Aid with this Product
reviews.reviewText: Unlike “non-natural” products like Cascade or Finish brand multi-formulated pods which have soap, detergent booster & rinse aid built into the pods, these Method pods are just soap. That means you need to use both dish detergent booster (I use Lemi-Shine brand) & rinse aid (I use 7th Generation brand) with these pods. Yes, that does make it more expensive, but unfortunately using natural substances costs more.I’ve been happily using these Method pods (WITH the other products mentioned above) for years and have had no film, no spots, etc. Only time I got a film was when a guest “kindly” started my dishwasher without putting in the detergent booster & my rinse aid was low. I got the white film off my dishes & inside of dishwasher by running dishwasher with the booster & rinse aid. Can’t remember if I put a soap pod in too, but I don’t think so.I live in an area with hard water. When I got my new dishwasher 4 years ago, the installer told me to be sure to use both a booster (helps with hard water) and rinse aid. He was right!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars DO NOT BUY IF YOU HAVE HARD WATER
reviews.reviewText: My dishes came out so filmy and hard water spots. I googled why and it said Organic dishwasher tablets do not clean well. I tried cleaning my glasses and plates with vinegar and baking soda and the are ruined. Still a film on them that after many washings does not come off.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Product Works Well and Good Value, but Storage Pouch needs better Design
reviews.reviewText: I have tried numerous brands and it seems like most of the higher priced ones with strong, harsh chemicals leave dishes and glasses spotless, but most of the so-called environmentally friendly dishwashing pod products sort of do a half-donkey job. This one does a great job, virtually the same as the non-environmentally friendly products, but comes shipped in a zip lock bag that after repeated use does NOT stay completely closed and will allow moisture around the kitchen and sink areas to start causing the pods to have their dissolvable, protective skin-like coatings to start dissolving prematurely which is not supposed to happen till their exposed to hot water in the dishwasher. I suppose I can buy a clear plastic storage jar from Amazon, but just one more thing to have to worry about doing

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars "It smells nice" is NOT a reason to buy!
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely horrible. As other reviewers have noted, white film all over everything in the dishwasher (and on the walls and elements of the dishwasher itself). I am a huge proponent of eco friendly and cruelty free products so I do appreciate that this product is not tested on animals nor does it include any animal byproducts. However, there is no way this is eco friendly or water wise when I have to rewash every glass, dish, and pan. We can purchase liquid hand soap and laundry detergent in eco friendly pouches; why can't manufacturers do the same for dishwasher detergent?!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better Than the Rest
reviews.reviewText: So glad I took a chance on these. I use other cleaning products by Method and love them, so I figured I couldn't go too wrong. Idk what it is, but these dishwasher pods clean my dishes much better than the rest. I was currently using leading brand Finish, but yeah...no! Method is where it's at! It smells great; not overpoweing, the value is great and it just gives my dishwashing cycle an overall cleaner finish. No more residue left in the pod compartment or bottom of the washer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars LOVE this Dishwasher Detergent! The BEST!!
reviews.reviewText: I am SO impressed! I love Method products, number one, because they are not tested on animals.But then there is performance! I ordered this in lieu of the product that I had been using, which was very good, but didnot get food off of dishes in the dishwasher. OK, I had a 20 year old dishwasher. But still. I got a new GE dishwasher, that I really love, but wasn't sureany dishwasher could get food off, and then finally decided to try. With these packets. I still get dried-on food off, I may test with that next.And I give the dishes a rinse, but some things like a glass that sat with lemonade or wine or a cup with yogurt residue or coffee andcream....ALL come magnificently clean!! And no rinsing agent needed! The manufacturer recommended a well-known brand of detergent and rinsing agent. All chemicals. All unnecessary.And most important to me, those brands are all (Ignorantly, Unnecessarily) tested on animals. Any chemicals they could possibly usehave already been tested. The companies know the results. Any further testing is just cruelty. See the NAVs website.

Works well sometimes leaves residue on my stainless steel colanders but it wipes off with a bit of vinegar fine. Better than chemical residue/smell from traditional cleaners. Was disappointed it’s an artificial scent but it didn’t leave any after smell or anything weird like that. Glass comes out nice and clean!

reviews.reviewTitle: Leaves hard scale stains in hard water
reviews.reviewText: We used ecover brand for years with our hard water which is not uncommon on prairies and the results were always fantastic. I forgot to buy new box so I realized that we don't have any tablets too late. The ecover is unavailable on amazon and I had to order it elsewhere. Meanwhile I just got these as they were next day delivery and thanksgiving weekend was coming up. Well these are pretty terrible. Switching from one last tablet of ecover to method ones showed the huge difference. They left hard water scale stains. The texture on top of glass and ceramic is rough. They stained even stainless steel with maps of white residue. After just couple loads during thanksgiving, they are going back returned. I am eagerly waiting my ecover tablets now.
Better than some other brands we have used in the past. The scent is not strong which we like and it does it's job.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent non-toxic replacement to conventional brands
reviews.reviewText: The best environmentally friendly dishwasher tab I’ve tried. My kitchen has softened water, in spite of this, other enviro-friendly brands (Seventh Generation, Nature Clean, Eco-Max) all left a white residue on clean dishes after the cycle was complete. This one doesn’t- I use the quick/energy saving cycle and my dishes come out clean and residue-free. So happy with it I use auto-delivery to make sure that I never run out.
We have a water softener, when we give a decent quick rinse it works well. Far better than any other natural dishwasher tab we have tried thus far.
